title: Kirk shooting suspect not speaking with investigators
body: NATO launches ‘Eastern Sentry’ operation Charlie Kirk shooting Gaza City destruction Nepal’s interim PM Coffee price surge Most unusual airport runways Simon Wohlfahrt/AFP/Getty Images NATO launches ‘Eastern Sentry’ operation in response to Russian drone incursions Russia just said what Ukraine has been trying to tell Trump for months: Peace talks are going nowhere fast Analysis Russia-Belarus military drill tests nerves on NATO’s eastern flank at the end of a tense week Planet Labs PBC Shocking satellite images show level of destruction in Gaza City in less than a month Israel conducted an unprecedented strike on a US ally. Here’s what happened behind the scenes Rubio to visit Israel with Gaza peace prospects grim and region reeling Kirk shooting suspect not speaking with investigators Show all • Live Updates Live Updates Utah Governor's Office Live Updates Tyler Robinson’s father recognized the 22-year-old, who confessed to him when confronted, sources say CNN Investigates What we know about Kirk shooting suspect Charlie Kirk’s final hours: How a stage for debate became a scene of tragedy Analysis Trump has turned up the temperature after Kirk’s killing. Spencer Cox is trying to turn it back down. Video Utah Gov. Cox delivers emotional message to young Americans 2:00 • Video 4:23 CNN Video ‘We got him’: See moment suspect is named 4:23 • Video 2:53 CNN Video Video shows suspect fleeing scene 2:53 • Video 3:13 The Charlie Kirk Show Video Who is Erika Kirk? 3:13 Catch up on today's global news - Source: CNN Video Catch up on today’s global news Ridofranz/iStockphoto/Getty Images Could a common nasal spray help block Covid-19? What a new study shows Nigel Wright/Mirrorpix/Getty Images David Bowie’s 15 favorite songs have been revealed DC Comics DC cancels comic book series after writer posts about Charlie Kirk’s death on social media • Video 1:28 CNN Video The $4,000-a-kilo matcha redefining Japan’s green gold 1:28 Ad Feedback More top stories • Breaking News Breaking News Jim West/UCG/Universal Images Group/Getty Images/File Breaking News Trump administration won’t make polluters report how much they’ve polluted Trump says he’s targeting Memphis in crime crackdown Man fatally shot during ICE traffic stop after dragging and injuring an officer in Chicago suburb, DHS says Former chief justice sworn in as Nepal’s interim PM following deadly protests Pigs’ heads left outside French mosques stoke suspicions of Russian interference Video Trump reacts to Bolsonaro conviction 0:35 Costa Rican authorities raid hotel in Miller Gardner death investigation Health & wellness CNN When you go overboard on protein, this is what can happen in your body Oleg Breslavtsev/Moment RF/Getty Images/File It’s time to address your insomnia — doing so could protect you against dementia, study says Sep 11, 2025 George Frey/Bloomberg/Getty Images Trump’s next plan to lower US drug prices: Raise them in other countries Sep 12, 2025 Ad Feedback Business & tech Mark Felix/Bloomberg/Getty Images A major subprime auto lender just went belly up. It won’t be like subprime mortgage lenders sparking the Great Recession Sep 12, 2025 Tomohiro Ohsumi/Getty Images Instax cameras knew when to wait. Now they’ve got a generation doing the same Sep 12, 2025 Kena Betancur/AFP/Getty Images Coffee prices haven’t surged this much in decades Sep 12, 2025 Ad Feedback Travel & beyond georgeclerk/iStock Unreleased/Getty Images The world’s strangest airport runways $150 for a wave: the Abu Dhabi wave pool targeting the ultra-rich Abu Dhabi has many of the things that surfers hunt for in their quest for perfect waves: warm weather, year-round sun and clear water. The only thing it did not have was waves. Sports corner Patrick Smith/Getty Images How a 16-year-old produced ‘the most impressive athletic feat in history’ Al Bello/Getty Images Canelo Álvarez vs. Terence Crawford: Two of boxing’s greats clash in a fight that’s being called one of the best ever Nicole Osborne/AP NHL makes 5 players acquitted of sexual assault charges eligible to sign contract, play this season Ad Feedback US Politics Mark Schiefelbein/AP Smithsonian wrestles with independence as White House review picks up Al Drago/Bloomberg/Getty Images How Hegseth neutralizes internal threats to safeguard his image as Trump’s secretary of defense Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images DC mayor’s handling of Trump deployment roils residents who want more pushback Celebrities and Entertainment • CNN Exclusive CNN Exclusive CraigMcDean/Courtesy EE72 CNN Exclusive He quit a job nobody quits. Here’s what British Vogue’s former editor did next Frazer Harrison/Getty Images Taylor Swift’s attorneys deny she has agreed to sit for deposition in Justin Baldoni and Blake Lively case Daniel Boczarski/Getty Images Rainn Wilson says ‘The Office’ was ‘based around clueless, insensitive, racist, sexist people’ Ad Feedback RFK Jr. Gabby Jones/Bloomberg/Getty Images In meeting with RFK Jr., CEO of Tylenol maker stresses there is no clear link between medication and autism, WSJ reports Why pesticides could threaten a MAGA-MAHA political divorce Art & style Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images See what the stars are wearing at New York Fashion Week Look of the Week: Jennifer Aniston and her old friend Tom Ford are a match made in heaven Trump's tariffs Pierre Albouy/Reuters Swatch trolls Trump’s 39% tariffs, selling a watch that flips the placement of 3 and 9 Trump says there’s ‘no inflation.’ But recent data shows prices are rising — partly due to his policies Ad Feedback Crime & investigations David Zalubowski/AP Colorado funeral director who acknowledged abusing 191 corpses withdraws guilty plea South Sudan’s vice president charged with treason and murder SCIENCE & DISCOVERY Bi Zhao Dinosaur eggs from China found to be around 86 million years old, according to ‘atomic clock’ dating Two billionaires have very different — equally wild — visions of a future in space. Is either possible? Climate & extreme weather CNN Weather You thought it was fall? A major pattern shift is starting Video Why Atlantic hurricane season has gone silent 1:13 Call to Earth Show all • Video 0:41 MBARI Video Newly discovered species spotted swimming by underwater camera 0:41 Amanda Voisard for The Washington Post/Getty Images Rhinos went extinct in Uganda 40 years ago. Now, a private ranch is home to almost 50 • Gallery Gallery EarnestTse/iStockphoto/Getty Images Gallery This huge bird flies from the Arctic to China. It’s been hunted to near extinction • Video 0:45 Marisa Teitge/Knornschild Lab Video World’s largest carnivorous bat loves to cuddle 0:45 Ad Feedback More from CNN Aurore Simonnet (SSU/EdEon)/LVK/URI Black hole collision confirms decades-old predictions by Einstein and Hawking Prince Harry makes surprise visit to Kyiv after reuniting with father, King Charles III Ethiopia opens massive hydropower dam against bitter Egyptian opposition CNN Exclusive Venezuela not seeking conflict with US, its foreign minister says Girl found dead in US identified as the daughter of Bear Brook serial killer Daniel Day-Lewis says he ‘never intended to retire’ from acting Get ready for more employment data revisions High-speed rail has come to America. title: Spinal Tap: The world's loudest band return with a little help from their famous friends
body: Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Home News Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK UK Politics England N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics Scotland Scotland Politics Wales Wales Politics Africa Asia China India Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Sport Business Executive Lounge Technology of Business Future of Business Innovation Technology Science & Health Artificial Intelligence AI v the Mind Culture Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Arts Arts in Motion Travel Destinations Africa Antarctica Asia Australia and Pacific Caribbean & Bermuda Central America Europe Middle East North America South America World’s Table Culture & Experiences Adventures The SpeciaList To the Ends of The Earth Earth Natural Wonders Weather & Science Climate Solutions Sustainable Business Green Living Audio Podcast Categories Radio Audio FAQs Video Live Live News Live Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters A 33-hour manhunt and morning show reveal: How police caught Charlie Kirk suspect "We got him," Utah Governor Spencer Cox said after authorities apprehended Tyler Robinson, the 22-year-old suspected of killing the conservative activist. 56 mins ago US & Canada How a college dropout from the suburbs became Maga star Charlie Kirk Kirk's loyalty towards the first family put him at the very centre of Donald Trump's Maga movement. 2 hrs ago US & Canada A 33-hour manhunt and morning show reveal: How police caught Charlie Kirk suspect "We got him," Utah Governor Spencer Cox said after authorities apprehended Tyler Robinson, the 22-year-old suspected of killing the conservative activist. 56 mins ago US & Canada How a college dropout from the suburbs became Maga star Charlie Kirk Kirk's loyalty towards the first family put him at the very centre of Donald Trump's Maga movement. 2 hrs ago US & Canada LIVE Charlie Kirk suspect brought into custody after confessing to father Tyler Robinson's father recognised his son from pictures released by the FBI - he then turned him in with the help of a friend, a youth pastor. North Korea executing more people for watching foreign films and TV, UN finds The report is based on more than 300 interviews with escapees from Kim Jong Un's secretive regime. 12 hrs ago Asia Memphis next US city to see National Guard troops, Trump says The deployment of the National Guard to Memphis comes roughly a month after he sent troops to Washington DC. 4 hrs ago US & Canada The wedding crasher mystery solved after four years For years Michelle and John Wylie were puzzled about the presence of a mysterious tall man in a blue suit at their wedding. 16 hrs ago Glasgow & West Scotland As Russian army inches closer, Ukrainians must decide to stay or go In Bilozerske, eastern Ukraine, people must make the agonising decision to flee or risk staying. 5 hrs ago Europe Only from the BBC The people who hunt down old TVs They are televisions from another era, replaced by the flat screen, high-resolution displays of the modern era. Yet cathode-ray tubes are still surprisingly in demand. The island nation remembering Britain's 'worst disaster' Britain's surrender of Singapore has long been viewed as a "humiliation". Now, a series of exhibits and tours are revealing how this dark event shaped British and Singaporean identity. Arts in Motion 'I really do not want to practice' Yuja Wang is one of the most exciting pianists of the 21st century. She credits falling in love with the piano to an early infatuation with the great Polish composer, Frédéric Chopin. See more The Global Story The Charlie Kirk blueprint How Kirk tried to make conservative ideas cool, and then export them around the world. 26 mins Save More news Nepal gets first female PM after deadly unrest Former Supreme Court chief justice Sushila Karki is sworn in after a deal with protest leaders. 1 hr ago Asia South Korean workers detained in US raid arrive home Media and some protesters gather at the airport as more than 300 workers detained in the US last week return. 13 hrs ago Business South Park episode lampooning Charlie Kirk pulled from Comedy Central The one with the character Clyde Donovan has been cut from Comedy Central but remains on Paramount+. 10 hrs ago Culture More than two million people evacuated from deadly floods in Pakistan Monsoon rains have killed more than 900 people across the country since late June. 17 hrs ago Asia Major Australian gas project extended until 2070 Stricter emissions targets have now been imposed on Woodside Energy's North West Shelf project. 13 hrs ago Australia South Korean workers detained in US raid arrive home Media and some protesters gather at the airport as more than 300 workers detained in the US last week return. 13 hrs ago Business Anti-apartheid hero's new inquest should lead to justice, Biko family tells BBC Seen as a martyr in the struggle against white-minority rule, Steve Biko died in police custody in 1977. 4 hrs ago Africa From political outsider to a president like no other: Bolsonaro's rise and fall The Brazilian ex-president has been sentenced to 27 years for plotting a coup, but an amnesty could be on the cards. 8 hrs ago Latin America South Park episode lampooning Charlie Kirk pulled from Comedy Central The one with the character Clyde Donovan has been cut from Comedy Central but remains on Paramount+. 10 hrs ago Culture Must Watch Utah governor details how Charlie Kirk murder suspect was apprehended The governor said a family member told investigators that the suspect had become "more political" in recent years. 6 hrs ago US & Canada 'Looks like a toy, but it's real': BBC examines a downed Russian drone Drones like this one were shot down over Polish airspace in the early hours of Wednesday. 18 hrs ago Europe What you need to know about Bolsonaro's coup prison sentence The former president of Brazil has been sentenced to 27 years in prison after being found guilty for plotting a military coup. 15 hrs ago Latin America BBC inside Utah university where Charlie Kirk was shot The BBC's Nada Tawfik gets a closer look at the crime scene and the inside of a classroom where students barricaded themselves after the shooting. 20 hrs ago US & Canada Beavers reintroduced after 400-year gap welcome babies The kits are caught on camera at the enclosure where the adults were released earlier this year. 13 hrs ago Northamptonshire See Kathmandu's destroyed and barricaded streets after violence There's an intense military presence on the Nepali capital's streets, says the BBC's Samira Hussain. 1 day ago Asia A rooftop figure, gunfire, then panic - how Charlie Kirk shooting unfolded The conservative activist and influential Trump ally was shot and killed while speaking at Utah Valley University. 1 day ago US & Canada Lawmakers react to Charlie Kirk shooting Democrats and Republicans condemned the killing of Charlie Kirk yesterday. 1 day ago US & Canada Music 15 of the best albums of 2025 so far From pop queens to rap duos, and rave-loving singers to hardcore rockers, we pick our favourite music of the year for you to listen to now. New dinosaur species named after fossil analysis What the NHS can learn from the European country that helped more people survive cancer Feeling stressed? Here's five ways to manage it better Culture Dutch broadcaster says it will join Eurovision boycott over Israel The Netherlands follows Ireland in saying it can "no longer justify Israel's inclusion" in the event. Spinal Tap: The world's loudest band return with a little help from their famous friends Ed Sheeran's Play: Can the pop star reclaim his crown? The power of Stephen King's most disturbing novel Arts How Jane Austen's secrets were destroyed forever Austen is one of the greatest writers in the English language – but relatively little is known about her. And that's in part because of an act that infuriates many to this day. The controversial sweet that fuels Norwegians The road trip that celebrates a musical legend Is cheese the new reason to travel? World's Table Paneer to poutine: Inside the world's local McDonald's From paneer wraps in India to ski-through burgers in Sweden, photojournalist Gary He's new book McAtlas shows that the world's most global chain is also one of the most local. The 'trash district' fuelling Mexico City's top restaurants Is 'pay what you can' the newest restaurant trend? The little-known isle where meals cook beneath your feet Earth How Japanese 'tiny forests' are sweeping Scotland Grown using the Miyawaki method, fast-growing miniature forests in the middle of cities can bring surprisingly big benefits for people and the environment. Water firm bans tankers from transporting water for billionaire's lake Bali's worst floods in a decade kill 14 Earth has now passed peak farmland. What's next? New York Times - Top Stories Live LIVE Killing of Charlie Kirk Sept. 12, 2025, 4:50 p.m. ET Trump Administration Sept. 12, 2025, 4:44 p.m. ET Top Stories Suspect Caught and Identified in Charlie Kirk Shooting LIVE Sept. 12, 2025, 4:50 p.m. ET Family Friend Contacted Authorities; Suspect Criticized Kirk Ahead of Shooting The 22-year-old suspect, held on suspicion of aggravated murder, indicated to a relative that he had shot Mr. Kirk on a Utah campus, the authorities said. What We Know About the Suspect 3 min read Orem, Utah Associated Press Orem, Utah By Reuters Orem, Utah Associated Press Orem, Utah Gov. Spencer Cox of Utah and F.B.I. Director Kash Patel. Loren Elliott for The New York Times Phoenix Makeshift vigils and memorials popped up for Kirk in Utah and Arizona. Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times Phoenix Vice President JD Vance arrived with Kirk's casket as it was sent home to Arizona. Associated Press Orem, Utah Loren Elliott for The New York Times Salt Lake City Niki Chan Wylie for The New York Times Orem, Utah Law enforcement personnel look for evidence in a residential area. Niki Chan Wylie for The New York Times Here’s What Some of the Bullet Casing Engravings in the Kirk Shooting Mean 1 min read The Daily Audio Special Episode: What the Assassination May Mean for the Conservative Movement 10 min listen Trump Administration Tariff Tracker Blunt-Force Diplomacy Crime Strategy Trump-Epstein Timeline E.P.A. to Stop Collecting Emissions Data From Polluters The data, from thousands of coal-burning power plants and other industrial facilities, is the country’s most comprehensive way to track greenhouse gases. 3 min read Rubio Leads Charge in Trump’s New War in Latin America Secretary of State Marco Rubio is shaping what could be the most consequential military actions of President Trump’s second term. 7 min read As the Fed Prepares to Lower Rates, 2 Seats on Its Board Are in Limbo 4 min read Grant Hindsley for The New York Times LIVE Sept. 12, 2025, 4:44 p.m. ET Tennessee’s Governor Welcomes Plan to Deploy Guard to Memphis F.D.A. Reviews Cases of Covid Vaccine Deaths 7 min read Protests in Nepal What to Know The Army, an Unlikely Partner Social Media Ban Backfires Scene in Kathmandu Anti-Corruption Crusader Named Nepal’s Leader After Gen Z Protests Sushila Karki, a former chief justice, was the choice of student protesters whose mass rallies started a violent uprising that toppled the government. 3 min read Who Is Nepal’s Caretaker Leader? 4 min read Sujan Gurung/Agence France-Presse Love, Drugs and a Fashion Breakup Worth $95 Million In the messy, public split of the Net-a-Porter founder Natalie Massenet and Erik Torstensson, no accusations seem off limits. 11 min read David M. What Comes Next? Jair Bolsonaro was sentenced to 27 years in prison for conspiring to cling to power after losing the 2022 elections. 4 min read Ana Ionova, Katrin Bennhold, Christina Thornell, Leila Medina and Laura Salaberry NATO Steps Up Defenses After Russian Drones Violate Polish Airspace Increased air patrols, air defense systems and other protections will be mobilized over Eastern Europe. 4 min read Opposition to Putin Pulls Up European Leaders Dragged Down at Home 5 min read Wojtek Radwanski/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images Man Fatally Shot in Confrontation With ICE Officers in Chicago Area An ICE officer fatally shot a man who drove his car into the officer during a stop near Chicago, an ICE spokesman said. 3 min read Freed From U.S. Detention, South Korean Workers Return Home to Tearful Cheers The workers, whose detention in a workplace immigration sweep set off outrage in South Korea, expressed both relief and anger. 4 min read Jiawei Wang He Made a Friend on Roblox. Their Relationship Turned Sinister. At age 7, Ethan Dallas began playing the online game, where he met Nate. Deadly abuse followed, said Ethan’s mother, who blames Roblox. 6 min read Ariana Drehsler for The New York Times The Great Read Is ‘The Pitt’ Really an ‘ER’ Spinoff? Michael Crichton’s Estate Says It Is. The estate of the best-selling author, which has intellectual property rights to “ER,” and the creators of the new hit TV show are waging a legal battle. 13 min read Photo illustration by Dragos Lemnei/The New York Times; NBC; HBO Max More Great Reads Britons Outraged as Billionaire Fills Private Lake Amid Water Restrictions Stephen Schwarzman, the Blackstone C.E.O., has been using private tankers to fill his lake even as dry weather has meant residents cannot water gardens. 3 min read Nathan Laine/Bloomberg David Ellison’s Spending at Paramount Has Changed Hollywood’s Mood Mr. Ellison has gotten off to a fast start as the owner of Paramount, at least when it comes to buying things. 5 min read Charly Triballeau/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images An Annual Blast of Pacific Cold Water Did Not Occur, Alarming Scientists The cold water upswell, which is vital to marine life, did not materialize for the first time on record. Researchers are trying to figure out why. 3 min read Oyvind Martinsen, via Alamy ideas Is It Abusive to Make Art About Your Children? It’s not quite #MeToo, but new memoirs are forcing a reckoning on what consent means when your parent is the artist. Right-Wing Activists Are Targeting People for Allegedly Celebrating Charlie Kirk’s Death Extremists and an anonymously run website are posting identifying details about people accused of celebrating Charlie Kirk’s murder online. title: Ukraine invasion — explained
body: FBI director Kash Patel (center) waits to speak at a press conference on Friday in Orem, Utah, following the fatal shooting of political activist Charlie Kirk during an event at Utah Valley University. Authorities announced that the suspect who shot and killed Kirk while he was speaking at an event for his "American Comeback Tour" has been apprehended and is in police custody. Michael Ciaglo/Getty Images hide caption toggle caption Michael Ciaglo/Getty Images Law The suspect in the Charlie Kirk killing has been arrested. Here's what we know The suspect has been identified as Tyler Robinson of Utah. Utah Gov. Spencer Cox said Robinson's family members reached out to a friend, who contacted the Washington County sheriff's office on Thursday. Utah Gov. Spencer Cox speaks at a press conference flanked by FBI Director Kash Patel following the fatal shooting of political activist Charlie Kirk on Friday in Orem, Utah. Michael Ciaglo/Getty Images hide caption toggle caption Michael Ciaglo/Getty Images Politics Utah governor, known for 'disagreeing better,' calls for calm after Kirk shooting Charlie Kirk throws hats to the crowd after arriving at Utah Valley University on Wednesday for a stop on his "American Comeback Tour." He was fatally shot less than an hour later. Trent Nelson/The Salt Lake Tribune/Getty Images hide caption toggle caption Trent Nelson/The Salt Lake Tribune/Getty Images National 33 hours: A timeline of Charlie Kirk's shooting and the search for a suspect Attendees hold candles during a candlelight vigil and prayer event for Turning Point USA Founder Charlie Kirk on Wednesday in Seattle. David Ryder/Getty Images hide caption toggle caption David Ryder/Getty Images Politics Charlie Kirk's young followers confront mourning, shock and questions about their future Laura Carmichael, left, Harry Hadden-Paton, Elizabeth McGovern, Hugh Bonneville and Michelle Dockery in Downton Abbey: The Grand Finale. Do you know what? Take our quiz This week, we had news of a drawing that may or may not be the president's, and of a rock that may or may not indicate that Mars had life. Connie Hanzhang Jin/NPR Life Kit Comic: 7 signs it's time to call it quits It's hard to know when to give up on a goal, especially when you've invested so much time, effort and resources into it. Here are 7 signals you might be ready to move on. A native of Washington, D.C., El Cousteau centers the city on Dirty Harry 2 , even when rapping about his journeys outside of it. Tyra Mitchell hide caption toggle caption Tyra Mitchell Review Music Reviews As life in D.C. becomes national news, a rapper shares his view from the ground A favorite of A$AP Rocky and Earl Sweatshirt, El Cousteau is a product of the District in every way. On Dirty Harry 2, he unpacks his upbringing with a nuance absent from national debate. In this file photo from Sept. 2023, a police car in Memphis is shown on the scene of a reported carjacking. On Sept. 12, President Trump announced in an interview on "Fox & Friends" Memphis will be the next site of federal action to combat crime, following intervention in the nation's capital, Washington, D.C. Brad Vest/Getty Images/Getty Images North America hide caption toggle caption Brad Vest/Getty Images/Getty Images North America Politics Memphis is the latest city Trump is targeting with federal government action to combat crime In an interview Friday morning, President Trump announced Memphis is his next target for federal intervention to combat crime. The president said he has support from Tennessee's governor and Memphis' mayor. Authorities investigate Friday after an ICE officer fatally shot a man during a traffic stop in suburban Franklin Park. Candace Dane Chambers/Sun-Times hide caption toggle caption Candace Dane Chambers/Sun-Times ICE officer fatally shoots man during traffic stop in Chicago suburb, authorities say WBEZ Chicago Immigration and Customs Enforcement says officers were conducting a "targeted law enforcement activity" when an officer shot a man during a traffic stop. Utah Gov. Spencer Cox, left, speaks with Utah Valley University Chief of Police Jeff Long, right, at a press conference at the Keller Building on the Utah Valley University campus after Charlie Kirk was shot and died during Turning Point's visit to the university, Wednesday, Sept. 10, 2025, in Orem, Utah. Hannah Schoenbaum/AP hide caption toggle caption Hannah Schoenbaum/AP National Charlie Kirk's killing raises the stakes for campus security How much security at a campus event is enough? Campus police are mulling the question. The tension between security and free speech on college campuses Listen · 4:05 4:05 Transcript Toggle more options Download Embed Embed < iframe src="https://www.npr.org/player/embed/nx-s1-5538453/nx-s1-9448720" width="100%" height="290" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" title="NPR embedded audio player"> Transcript The killing of Charlie Kirk adds to a time of political upheaval and violence Trump blames rhetoric from left for political violence after the killing of a conservative activist Utah Valley University student Koby Herrera stands in a grassy area on the edge of campus Thursday. Herrera was a fan of conservative political influencer Charlie Kirk and witnessed his fatal shooting the day before. Martha Harris/KUER hide caption toggle caption Martha Harris/KUER Utah students grapple with Charlie Kirk's shooting after they 'watched a man die' KUER 90.1 Even though the Orem campus of Utah Valley University is closed, some students gathered the day after political influencer Charlie Kirk was fatally shot to grieve and pay their respects. Sponsor Message A Boston Dynamics robot is seen on a media tour at the Hyundai Motor Group Metaplant, in Ellabell, Ga., in March. Mike Stewart/AP hide caption toggle caption Mike Stewart/AP Word of the week A play about the revolt of human workers — not machines — gave us the word 'robot' A Czech playwright introduced the word to English in the 1920s. But back then, it wasn't analogous to machinery. New interpretations of the robot reflect a modernity once skewered by the writer. A play about the revolt of workers – not machinery – gave us the word ‘robot’ Listen · 2:34 2:34 Transcript Toggle more options Download Embed Embed < iframe src="https://www.npr.org/player/embed/nx-s1-5532095/nx-s1-9448453" width="100%" height="290" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" title="NPR embedded audio player"> Transcript Simons & Schuster Review Book Reviews A new biography zeroes in on Lin-Manuel Miranda's superpower The secret to his success isn't just genius — it's collaboration a lot of creative friends. Author Daniel Pollack-Pelzner interviewed more than 150 people for his biography about the Hamilton creator. Prosecutors Isia Jasiewicz, Jennifer Blackwell, Sara Levine and Carolyn Jackson left the U.S. Attorney's office in Washington this year. Now they're working together again in the office of the Commonwealth's Attorney for Arlington County, Va. hide caption toggle caption Law These fired DOJ lawyers are finding new ways to make a difference Four prosecutors who worked on Capitol riot cases have found a way to continue public service after leaving the Justice Department. They're all colleagues again. These fired DOJ lawyers are finding new ways to make a difference Listen · 4:09 4:09 Transcript Toggle more options Download Embed Embed < iframe src="https://www.npr.org/player/embed/nx-s1-5534402/nx-s1-9449057" width="100%" height="290" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" title="NPR embedded audio player"> Transcript In this photo provided by the Railway of Ukraine Ukrzaliznytsia on Friday, Sept. 12, 2025, Britain's Prince Harry, right, arrives at railway station in Kyiv region, Ukraine. Railway of Ukraine Ukrzaliznytsia/AP hide caption toggle caption Railway of Ukraine Ukrzaliznytsia/AP Ukraine invasion — explained Prince Harry makes surprise visit to Ukraine in support of wounded troops Britain's Prince Harry has arrived in Ukraine for a surprise visit in support of wounded service members. Nepal's then-chief Justice of the Supreme Court, Sushila Karki (right), observes a minute's silence during Democracy Day in Kathmandu, Nepal, Feb. 18, 2017. Niranjan Shrestha/AP hide caption toggle caption Niranjan Shrestha/AP Asia Nepal appoints a former chief justice as interim prime minister and first woman leader Nepal 's president appointed former Supreme Court Chief Justice Sushila Karki as interim prime minister. She is the first woman to head the nation's government. Anti-apartheid activist Stephen Biko is seen in this undated image. Argus/AFP hide caption toggle caption Argus/AFP Africa South Africa reopens an inquest into the death of anti-apartheid leader Steve Biko South Africa has reopened the investigation into the death of Biko — 48 years after he was killed in police custody. Cicadas from a 17-year cicada brood and shells shed by cicada nymphs sit at the base of a tree on May 29, 2024, in Park Ridge, Ill. Cicadas are of the order Hemiptera — the type of winged insects commonly found in the study of insect declines. Scott Olson/Getty Images hide caption toggle caption Scott Olson/Getty Images Science Insect populations drop even without direct human interference, a new study finds Research published this month found that even in pristine, untouched areas, insect populations are still on the decline. Climate change is a likely culprit. Sponsor Message A male tarantula looks for a mate on the plains near La Junta, Colo., Friday, Sept. 27, 2024. Thomas Peipert/AP hide caption toggle caption Thomas Peipert/AP Animals Male tarantulas are moving and wooing their way across Colorado These hairy spiders spend almost all of their lives underground. But when it's time to mate, they must brave the great outdoors before they perish. Katherine Du/NPR National Are hotel rooms accessible for people who use wheelchairs? NPR wants to hear from you Hotels have accessible rooms for wheelchair users. If you or someone you know has experienced problems with those rooms, we'd like to hear about it. Arizona Gov. Katie Hobbs gives a brief speech prior to then-President Biden's remarks at the Tempe Center for the Arts on Sept. 28, 2023, in Tempe, Arizona. Biden delivered remarks on protecting democracy and honoring the legacy of the late Sen. John McCain, and revealed funding for the McCain Library. Rebecca Noble/Getty Images hide caption toggle caption Rebecca Noble/Getty Images Arizona's governor issues executive order expanding COVID-19 vaccine access KJZZ The order allows pharmacists to administer vaccines in line with guidance from national health organizations. Jill Holm-Denoma holds her son, Tyler, after he received a COVID shot in 2021 from nurse Emily Cole at National Jewish Health in Denver. After President Trump appointed anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. to be Secretary of Health and Human Services, Colorado updated state laws to ensure continued access to the COVID shot and other vaccines. David Zalubowski/AP hide caption toggle caption David Zalubowski/AP Public Health Wary of RFK Jr., Colorado started revamping its vaccine policies last spring CPR News While Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., dismantles the federal institutions that set vaccine policy, states like Colorado are changing laws and regulations in an effort to preserve access to vaccines. Therese McRae with her daughter Matilda (left), Stephan Neidenbach (upper right, with his family) and Jason Mitton (lower right) all have been seeking the COVID vaccine and having trouble getting it. Therese McRae; Stephan Neidenbach; and Jason Mitton hide caption toggle caption Therese McRae; Stephan Neidenbach; and Jason Mitton Your Health They want COVID shots to protect their health or family. They can't get them Though the FDA narrowed criteria for the shots, many people still want them, to avoid illness and protect vulnerable family members. Some are turned down at the pharmacy or have to jump through hoops. New federal restrictions on COVID-19 vaccine eligibility cause confusion and anger Listen · 3:50 3:50 Transcript Toggle more options Download Embed Embed < iframe src="https://www.npr.org/player/embed/nx-s1-5538105/nx-s1-9447432" width="100%" height="290" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" title="NPR embedded audio player"> Transcript Senate Majority Leader John Thune, R-S.D., speaks to the media following a Senate policy luncheon at the U.S. Capitol on Tuesday. Senate Republicans have voted to change the chamber's rules in order to speed confirmation of President Trump's nominees. Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images hide caption toggle caption Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images Politics Senate Republicans turn to 'nuclear option' to speed confirmation of Trump nominees The change will allow certain nominees to be confirmed in groups rather than by individual vote. It follows months of GOP complaints that Democrats were dragging out the confirmation process. The grand foyer in the John F. Kennedy Center for the performing arts Ron Blunt/Kennedy Center hide caption toggle caption Ron Blunt/Kennedy Center Culture The head of jazz at the Kennedy Center is the latest firing at the beleaguered arts institution The firing of Kevin Struthers is the latest in a line of dismissals and resignations at the D.C. arts behemoth. Sponsor Message Reality Winner Christopher Lee/ Spiegel & Grau hide caption toggle caption Christopher Lee/ Spiegel & Grau Author Interviews NSA leaker Reality Winner is rebuilding her life — and looking back at her past Winner was working at the NSA in 2017 when she leaked a classified document to the press. Soon after, the FBI showed up at her door. Winner's new memoir is I Am Not Your Enemy. FA: Reality Winner, I am Not Your Enemy Listen · 37:43 37:43 Transcript Toggle more options Download Embed Embed < iframe src="https://www.npr.org/player/embed/nx-s1-5530026/nx-s1-9448091" width="100%" height="290" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" title="NPR embedded audio player"> Transcript When two black holes merge, they release gravitational waves. These waves can be picked up by detectors on Earth, allowing scientists to better understand them. Maggie Chiang/Simons Foundation hide caption toggle caption Maggie Chiang/Simons Foundation Science After 10 years of black hole science, Stephen Hawking is proven right Researchers have spent 10 years improving the massive detectors they use to catch shockwaves from colliding black holes, and now the science is precise enough to test one of Stephen Hawking's key ideas. body: Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Metroid Prime 4: Beyond will be released on December 4 for Switch and Switch 2 Nintendo's latest console gets an enhanced version. Lawrence Bonk 7 hours ago Mario, Metroid, Virtual Boy and more: all the biggest announcements from today's Nintendo Direct Kris Holt 4 hours ago Nintendo is bringing back the Virtual Boy as a Switch and Switch 2 accessory Kris Holt 7 hours ago Everything Apple revealed at the iPhone 17 launch event: iPhone Air, iPhone 17 Pro, AirPods Pro 3 and more Valentina Palladino 09.09.2025 One year of Paramount+ is on sale for as low as $30 right now Anna Washenko 6 hours ago Apple iPhone 17 event Latest stories Instagram fixed an issue that caused posting multiple Stories to tank your reach Instagram fixed a bug that made posting multiple Stories in a day hurt the reach of your Stories overall. Balatro's big 2025 update won't be coming out this year after all Developer LocalThunk just revealed that the Balatro 1.1 update will not be coming in 2025. It will, however, be free on all platforms. The best iPad deals you can get right now include the iPad A16 for $299 Here are the best iPad deals we could find -- along with a few other Apple deals we spotted. Mario, Metroid, Virtual Boy and more: all the biggest announcements from today's Nintendo Direct Who's ready for more Donkey Kong Bananza? (Yes, already.) Fire Emblem: Fortune's Weave comes out for the Switch 2 in 2026 Fire Emblem: Fortune's Weave will hit the Nintendo Switch 2 in 2026. It's the next installment in the long-running tactical RPG series. FTC investigating ad sale practices at Google and Amazon The FTC is investigating Google and Amazon over ad sale practices for search. Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade hits the Switch 2 on January 22 Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade comes out for the Switch 2 on January 22, 2026. This is the Midgar portion of the game. The iPhone 17 square selfie camera is a bigger deal than you think The iPhone 17's new square camera sensor could lead to another selfie revolution for Apple. One year of Paramount+ is on sale for as low as $30 right now Annual subscriptions are 50 percent off and the discount applies to both the Essential and Premium plans. Pokémon Pokopia looks like Animal Crossing for Pokémon fans and I'm here for it For fans of cozy games, Pokémon Pokopia looks like a must play. Nintendo is bringing back the Virtual Boy as a Switch and Switch 2 accessory Games from the mid-90s tabletop console will start hitting Switch Online + Expansion Pack on February 17. Donkey Kong Bananza is getting a DLC expansion today One of the best games of the year is getting a brand-new mode today. Pick up an Anker magnetic power bank while they are up to 42 percent off Some of our favorite Anker magnetic power banks are on sale right now. Hades II is coming to Switch and Switch 2 on September 25 It reaches version 1.0 after 16 months in early access. Metroid Prime 4: Beyond will be released on December 4 for Switch and Switch 2 The long-awaited Metroid Prime 4 is coming on December 4. It will be released for the original Switch and the new Switch 2. Mario Tennis Fever hits the court on February 12 The new Mario Tennis game arrives early next year with the largest roster in series history. Yoshi and the Mysterious Book is a new platformer coming to the Switch 2 next spring A new Yoshi platformer is coming to the Switch 2 next spring. Super Mario Bros. Wonder is getting a Switch 2 version with new multiplayer modes Several new multiplayer modes are coming to the Switch 2 version of Super Mario Bros. Wonder. The Super Mario Galaxy Movie will be Mario's next crack at the big screen Nintendo just released a trailer for the next Mario movie. It hits theaters in April. The Environmental Protection Agency wants to stop collecting data on greenhouse gas emissions from power plants and other polluting sites. The proposed rule change comes as the Trump administration attempts to get rid of the agency’s ability to regulate planet-heating pollution at all. E.P.A. The app had an outage this morning, leaving many users staring at an unread count, even after reading all their messages. Slack reports it’s fixed , but if your app is still stuck, hitting CMD + Shift + R (Mac) or CTRL + Shift + R (Windows) to force refresh should clear things up. Slack System Status - Activity badge display issue [ Slack ] J Twitter Comments 0 Jay Peters 5:45 PM UTC Link Cloud’s everywhere. The full Final Fantasy VII remake trilogy is going to be multiplatform, Square Enix says . The company still hasn’t revealed when the third game might come out, but now I’m curious if it won’t be a PlayStation exclusive at launch like the first two games were. It’s yet another sign of how the AI talent wars are intensifying — both stateside and between the U.S. and China. Tencent Hires OpenAI Researcher as China Steps Up Talent Search [ Bloomberg ] News News Encyclopedia Britannica and Merriam-Webster sue Perplexity for copying their definitions Elissa Welle 5:23 PM UTC Tech Tech Don’t buy the standard Galaxy Watch 8 when the Classic is just $10 more Sheena Vasani 3:35 PM UTC Borderlands 4 turns off your brain and turns on the fun If you liked what the previous games have done, you sure are getting exactly more of that. Ash Parrish Sep 11 News News The Powerbeats Pro 2 are getting heart rate monitoring updates with iOS 26 Andrew Liszewski 3:20 PM UTC Just For You Just For You 1 You can now play Silksong on flagship Android phones — and pick up where you left off on PC Sean Hollister Sep 11 2 Gmail is launching a tab for all your Amazon purchases Emma Roth Sep 11 3 Baseus’ solar-powered dash cam keeps an eye on your parked car for up to two weeks Andrew Liszewski Sep 11 4 Mario’s going to space in The Super Mario Galaxy Movie trailer Ash Parrish 1:18 PM UTC 5 Sony’s new Xperia phone jumps on the camera bar bandwagon Dominic Preston 11:02 AM UTC J External Link Comments 0 Jay Peters 3:19 PM UTC Link The big Balatro 1.1 update will now be “done when it’s done.” The update was announced last year with a 2025 release window, but anonymous developer LocalThunk wants to avoid crunching on the update, he says in a blog post . “I have never, before Balatro , set a deadline for any of my creative projects and I now realize how important that is for my process.” I’m Slow — LocalThunk [ LocalThunk ] News News Fight for glory in Fire Emblem: Fortune’s Weave coming to the Switch 2 next year Ash Parrish 2:48 PM UTC Pokemon Pokemon Pokémon Legends: Z-A’s first DLC will take you to the Mega Dimension Charles Pulliam-Moore 2:34 PM UTC The eight biggest announcements from Apple’s iPhone Air event Apple’s thinnest iPhone yet, its most capable wearables, its best AirPods Pro, and a lot more. Cameron Faulkner Sep 9 E External Link Comments 0 Emma Roth 2:25 PM UTC Link Spotify’s editors will deliver weekly recommendations in a new video series. Every Friday, Spotify will release “The Drop,” where its editors highlight the latest in music in a series of scrollable, vertical video clips. You can find the new series on the app’s homepage or by searching “The Drop Weekly.” Spotify’s ‘The Drop Weekly’ Brings You the Week in New Releases, Straight From Our Editors — Spotify [ Spotify ] News News The next Pokémon looks a bit like Minecraft Andrew Webster 2:08 PM UTC Tech Tech See all Tech Ultraloq adds Android tap-to-unlock to its Apple Home Key smart lock Jennifer Pattison Tuohy 1:43 PM UTC Apple Watch hypertension alerts cleared by FDA for new and old watches Thomas Ricker 6:10 AM UTC Encyclopedia Britannica and Merriam-Webster sue Perplexity for copying their definitions Elissa Welle 5:23 PM UTC News News Bring death to Chronos in Hades 2 this September Ash Parrish 2:05 PM UTC News News Metroid Prime 4 goes beyond, launching this December Ash Parrish 1:56 PM UTC Nintendo Nintendo Virtual Boy games are coming to Nintendo Switch Online Andrew Webster 1:49 PM UTC News News Ultraloq adds Android tap-to-unlock to its Apple Home Key smart lock Jennifer Pattison Tuohy 1:43 PM UTC How Wikipedia survives while the rest of the internet breaks The world’s largest encyclopedia became the factual foundation of the web, but now it’s under attack. Josh Dzieza Sep 4 News News Mastodon is bringing quote posts to the fediverse Emma Roth 1:07 PM UTC Podcasts Podcasts See all Podcasts 1 Our hottest takes on AI’s wild summer David Pierce 2:02 PM UTC 2 Sierra CEO Bret Taylor on why the AI bubble feels like the dotcom boom Alex Heath Sep 11 3 The orange iPhone stole the show David Pierce Sep 10 4 Sal Khan is hopeful that AI won’t destroy education Hank Green Sep 8 5 Your robot is about to get its own robot Jacob Kastrenakes Sep 5 Tech Tech A new Astro Bot-themed PS5 controller is now available for preorder Brandon Russell 1:00 PM UTC Nintendo Nintendo Nintendo Direct September 2025: all the news and trailers Andrew Webster 2:48 PM UTC A Comments 0 Andrew Liszewski 12:33 PM UTC Link The Nintendo Today app has added special features unlocked by inaudible sounds. Nintendo Today was updated to version 2.0 today with a new Kirby theme and exclusive content for the Nintendo Live 2025 event in Tokyo. But it will only be accessible at the event using an inaudible sound broadcasted at the venue the app will listen for to verify attendance. If you buy something from a Verge link, Vox Media may earn a commission. See our ethics statement. A Youtube Comments 0 Andrew Webster 12:30 PM UTC Link Switch, too. Nintendo has decided to give us all a welcome break from doomscrolling with its latest Direct livestream, which is happening very soon at 9AM ET. It’ll last around an hour, and you can watch it either via the YouTube embed below, or through Nintendo’s news app . If you buy something from a Verge link, Vox Media may earn a commission. See our ethics statement. News News iPhone Air launch delayed in China over eSIM issues Dominic Preston 12:06 PM UTC T External Link Comments 0 Thomas Ricker 12:02 PM UTC Link Merde! AirPods don’t support live translation in Europe. “Live translation with AirPods is not available if you are in the EU and your Apple account country or region is also in the EU,” reads the Apple support page . According to Politico , Apple is blaming DMA’s interoperability requirement for the limitation. Apple blocks translation AirPods in EU over regulatory concerns [ POLITICO ] Science Science See all Science NASA found clues of life on Mars, but budget cuts threaten future missions Georgina Torbet Sep 11 Apple Watch hypertension alerts cleared by FDA for new and old watches Thomas Ricker 6:10 AM UTC Trump is slowing — but not stopping — US greenhouse gas reductions Justine Calma Sep 10 Tech Tech Apple’s 2025 iPhone lineup is now available to preorder Brandon Russell 12:00 PM UTC News News Sony’s new Xperia phone jumps on the camera bar bandwagon Dominic Preston 11:02 AM UTC D Quote Comments 0 Dominic Preston 11:00 AM UTC Link Medieval media. Yesterday it was reported that the just-merged Paramount Skydance corporation wants to merge a little more, exploring acquiring Warner Bros. Discovery . Or, as one commenter pointed out, it’s all getting a bit medieval. BlueClouds: Ah yes, we rejoice that our feudal overlords will unite their great houses under one royal banner! Get the day’s best comment and more in my free newsletter, The Verge Daily . R External Link Comments 0 Robert Hart 9:27 AM UTC Link Tech groupies on tour. After schmoozing at Mar-a-Lago, fawning at the White House , and traipsing to the Middle East, some of Silicon Valley’s biggest names are set to join Donald Trump on a state visit to the UK next week, including OpenAI’s Sam Altman and Nvidia’s Jensen Huang. Apple’s Tim Cook has reportedly been invited as well. A wave of investments and deals are expected, with Bloomberg today reporting billions in anticipated data center funding from OpenAI and Nvidia. OpenAI, Nvidia CEOs to Announce UK Data Center Investments [ Bloomberg News ] News News Microsoft avoids EU fine after Slack complained about Teams bundling Tom Warren 8:46 AM UTC D Comments 0 Dominic Preston 8:18 AM UTC Link Phew, Apple’s polishing cloth is iPhone 17-compatible after all. We were all worried when Apple’s cloth didn’t support its new models on day one , but the company must have pushed an OTA update just in time for preorders today . All four new iPhones are supported, plus the three new Watch models. Di Benedetto 7:30 AM UTC J External Link Comments 0 Jay Peters Sep 11 Link Google will stop offering the built-in Weather app for Wear OS 6 (and newer) watches. Google says the change is due to “your favorite watch brands offering their own default weather apps on Wear OS.” If you have a Pixel Watch, you’ll use the Pixel Weather app. With watches from other companies, new users will have to use the default or download a new app. Changes to Google's built-in Weather app on Wear OS 6+ - Wear OS by Google Community [ https://support.google.com ] News News Microsoft and OpenAI have a new deal that could clear the way for an IPO Richard Lawler Sep 11 J External Link Comments 0 Jay Peters Sep 11 Link Google’s Airtable competitor is shutting down. Google Tables won’t be supported after December 16th, TechCrunch reports . (I admittedly didn’t know Google Tables was a thing.) The tool came from Google’s Area 120 incubator, according to TechCrunch . body: MongoDB Atlas: Multi-cloud, modern database on AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud. Get access to our most high performance version ever, with faster and easier scaling at lower cost. × 179192216 story EU Countries Delay Deal on New Climate Goal, Diplomats Say (reuters.com) 2 Posted by msmash on Friday September 12, 2025 @04:30PM from the how-about-that dept. An anonymous reader shares a report: European Union countries have shelved plans to approve a new climate change target next week, after pushback from governments including France and Germany over plans to quickly land a deal, three EU diplomats told Reuters on Friday. Countries are discussing a legally-binding target to cut net EU greenhouse gas emissions by 90% by 2040, from 1990 levels - with a share of this covered by buying foreign carbon credits. The European Commission has said this would offer investors certainty and keep Europe on track for net zero emissions by 2050. Climate change has made Europe the world's fastest-warming continent, unleashing deadly heatwaves and record-breaking wildfires. But EU governments are divided over how ambitious to be in tackling global warming, as governments also try to increase defence spending and support struggling industries. 179191770 story Colleges Are About to See a Big Decline in Applicants (nymag.com) 21 Posted by msmash on Friday September 12, 2025 @03:54PM from the shape-of-things-to-come dept. US colleges face a prolonged enrollment decline beginning this fall as high school graduating classes shrink for the first time since the Great Recession. The incoming freshman class marks the start of a 13% drop in high school graduates through 2041, falling from 3.9 million to 3.4 million students. The decline stems from reduced birth rates during the 2008 financial crisis and subsequent years. Regional four-year institutions in the Northeast and Midwest states face potential applicant pool contractions of 15% or more. Small liberal arts colleges, comprising 40% of the higher education market, are particularly vulnerable. 40% of private colleges posted financial losses in 2023. Top-ranked schools in the US News top 50 are expected to experience minimal impact due to sustained national demand for limited seats. 179190962 story Coffee Prices Post Largest Annual Jump Since 1997 (cnn.com) 39 Posted by msmash on Friday September 12, 2025 @03:10PM from the bitter-brew dept. US retail coffee prices surged 21% year-over-year in August , the largest annual increase since October 1997, according to Thursday's Consumer Price Index. The monthly 4% jump marks the steepest rise in 14 years. Trump administration tariffs on major coffee exporters -- 50% on Brazil, 20% on Vietnam, and 10% on Colombia -- are driving costs higher as 99% of US coffee consumption relies on imports. J.M. Smucker plans its third price increase this winter for Folgers and Cafe Bustelo brands after raising prices in May and August. New Orleans chain French Truck Coffee has implemented a 4% tariff surcharge. Starbucks expects peak cost impacts in 2026 due to its advance purchasing practices. KPMG chief economist Diane Swonk predicts prices will exceed historical records as Brazilian tariff effects reach retail shelves. 179189306 story Everyone Is Making Smart Glasses Now (uploadvr.com) 4 Posted by msmash on Friday September 12, 2025 @02:30PM from the glasses-all-the-way-down dept. Smart glasses development has expanded beyond Meta, Google and Apple to include dozens of manufacturers across three distinct categories , UploadVR reports. HTC launched its Vive Eagle glasses in Taiwan this month at $550, while Solos' AirGo V2 arrives in Q4 2025 for $300. The market segments into displayless models featuring cameras and AI assistants, heads-up display glasses providing contextual information overlays and true AR glasses capable of spatial object positioning. Chinese manufacturers dominate the sub-$100 segment. Snap plans consumer AR glasses for 2026. Amazon is reportedly developing two HUD models targeting delivery drivers and consumers for mid-2026 release. 179189416 story Opendoor Board Chair Says Company is 'Bloated,' Needs To Cut 85% of Workforce (cnbc.com) 37 Posted by msmash on Friday September 12, 2025 @01:40PM from the going-nuclear dept. Keith Rabois, co-founder and newly minted board chair of Opendoor, said remote work and a "bloated" workforce have been a drag on the online real estate platform's culture, as he vowed to slash headcount . CNBC: "There's 1,400 employees at Opendoor. I don't know what most of them do. We don't need more than 200 of them," Rabois told CNBC's "Squawk on the Street" on Friday. 179189042 story Microsoft is Making 'Significant Investments' in Training Its Own AI Models (theverge.com) 10 Posted by msmash on Friday September 12, 2025 @01:13PM from the tussle-continues dept. A anonymous reader shares a report: Microsoft AI launched its first in-house models last month, adding to the already complicated relationship with its OpenAI partner. Now, Microsoft AI chief Mustafa Suleyman says the company is making "significant investments" in the compute capacity required to Microsoft's own future frontier models. "We should have the capacity to build world class frontier models in house of all sizes, but we should be very pragmatic and use other models where we need to," said Suleyman during Microsoft's employee-only town hall on Thursday. "We're also going to be making significant investments in our own cluster, so today MAI-1-preview was only trained on 15,000 H100s, a tiny cluster in the grand scheme of things." Suleyman hinted that Microsoft has ambitions to train models that are comparable to Meta, Google, and xAI's efforts on clusters that are "six to ten times larger in size" than what Microsoft used for its MAI-1-preview. "Much more to do, but it's good to take the first steps," said Suleyman. 179187304 story AI-generated Medical Data Can Sidestep Usual Ethics Review, Universities Say (nature.com) 28 Posted by msmash on Friday September 12, 2025 @12:02PM from the closer-look dept. An anonymous reader shares a report : Medical researchers at some institutions in Canada, the United States and Italy are using data created by artificial intelligence (AI) from real patient information in their experiments without the need for permission from their institutional ethics boards, Nature has learnt. To generate what is called 'synthetic data', researchers train generative AI models using real human medical information, then ask the models to create data sets with statistical properties that represent, but do not include, human data. Typically, when research involves human data, an ethics board must review how studies affect participants' rights, safety, dignity and well-being. However, institutions including the IRCCS Humanitas Research Hospital in Milan, Italy, the Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO) in Ottawa and the Ottawa Hospital, both in Canada, and Washington University School of Medicine (WashU Medicine) in St. Louis, Missouri, have waived these requirements for research involving synthetic data. The reasons the institutions use to justify this decision differ. However, the potential benefits of using synthetic data include protecting patient privacy, being more easily able to share data between sites and speeding up research, says Khaled El Emam, a medical AI researcher at the CHEO Research Institute and the University of Ottawa. 179179856 story Google is Shutting Down Tables, Its Airtable Rival 9 Posted by msmash on Friday September 12, 2025 @11:21AM from the google-graveyard dept. Google Tables, a work-tracking tool and competitor to the popular spreadsheet-database hybrid Airtable , is shutting down . TechCrunch: In an email sent to Tables users this week, Google said the app will not be supported after December 16, 2025, and advised that users export or migrate their data to either Google Sheets or AppSheet instead, depending on their needs. Launched in 2020, Tables focused on making project tracking more efficient with automation. It was one of the many projects to emerge from Google's in-house app incubator, Area 120, which at the time was devoted to cranking out a number of experimental projects. Some of these projects later graduated to become a part of Google's core offerings across Cloud, Search, Shopping, and more. Tables was one of those early successes: Google said in 2021 that the service was moving from a beta test to become an official Google Cloud product. At the time, the company said it saw Tables as a potential solution for a variety of use cases, including project management, IT operations, customer service tracking, CRM, recruiting, product development and more. 179179022 story Swiss Government Looks To Undercut Privacy Tech, Stoking Fears of Mass Surveillance (therecord.media) 14 Posted by msmash on Friday September 12, 2025 @10:40AM from the how-about-that dept. The Swiss government could soon require service providers with more than 5,000 users to collect government-issued identification , retain subscriber data for six months and, in many cases, disable encryption. From a report: The proposal, which is not subject to parliamentary approval, has alarmed privacy and digital-freedoms advocates worldwide because of how it will destroy anonymity online, including for people located outside of Switzerland. A large number of virtual private network (VPN) companies and other privacy-preserving firms are headquartered in the country because it has historically had liberal digital privacy laws alongside its famously discreet banking ecosystem. Proton, which offers secure and end-to-end encrypted email along with an ultra-private VPN and cloud storage, announced on July 23 that it is moving most of its physical infrastructure out of Switzerland due to the proposed law. The company is investing more than $117 million in the European Union, the announcement said, and plans to help develop a "sovereign EuroStack for the future of our home continent." Switzerland is not a member of the EU. Proton said the decision was prompted by the Swiss government's attempt to "introduce mass surveillance." 179178656 story Nepal's Social Media Ban Backfires as Politics Moves To a Chat Room (nytimes.com) 13 Posted by msmash on Friday September 12, 2025 @10:01AM from the closer-look dept. An anonymous reader shares a report: An attempt to ban social media in Nepal ended this week in violent protest with the prime minister ousted, the Parliament in flames and soldiers on the streets of the capital. Now, the very technology the government tried to outlaw is being harnessed to help select the country's next leader , as more than 100,000 citizens are meeting regularly in a virtual chat room to debate the country's future. More than 30 people were killed in clashes with the police during youth-led protests that convulsed the capital in a paroxysm of outrage over wealth inequality, corruption and plans to ban some social media platforms. After the government's collapse on Tuesday, the military imposed a curfew across the capital, Kathmandu, and restricted large gatherings. With the country in political limbo and no obvious next leader in place, Nepalis have taken to Discord, a platform popularized by video gamers, to enact the digital version of a national convention. "The Parliament of Nepal right now is Discord," said Sid Ghimiri, 23, a content creator from Kathmandu, describing how the site has become the center of the nation's political decision making. The conversation inside the Discord channel, taking place in a combination of voice, video, and text chats, is so consequential that it is being discussed on national television and live streamed on news sites. 179172064 story Apache Software Foundation Unveils Its Branding Overhaul With New Logo, 'The ASF' Name (phoronix.com) 58 Posted by BeauHD on Friday September 12, 2025 @09:00AM from the community-over-code dept. The Apache Software Foundation has unveiled a major branding overhaul that retires its three-decade-old feather logo after criticism from Native American activists. In its place is a new oak leaf design to symbolize endurance, resilience, and global reach. Along with the new visual identity, the group will emphasize "The ASF" as its shorthand name while keeping its full legal title intact. Apache.org explained : "The oak is one of the most enduring trees and is found around the world. It grows slowly but steadily, supporting vast ecosystems and lasting for centuries. In the same way, The ASF has served as a stable, resilient steward of open source for more than 25 years and is looking to the long future ahead. Choosing the oak leaf as our new logo represents the enduring power of our ethos: community over code." 179171798 story Scientists Link Hundreds of Severe Heat Waves To Fossil Fuel Producers' Pollution 119 Posted by BeauHD on Friday September 12, 2025 @06:00AM from the connecting-the-dots dept. A new study published in Nature links more than 200 severe heat waves directly to greenhouse gas pollution from major fossil fuel producers like ExxonMobil, Chevron, and BP. Researchers found that up to a quarter of these heat waves would have been virtually impossible without emissions from oil, coal, and cement companies. NPR reports: The new study, published Wednesday in the journal Nature , found that 213 heat waves were substantially more likely and intense because of the activity of major fossil fuel producers, also called carbon majors. They include oil, coal and cement companies, as well as some countries. The scientists found as much as a quarter of the heat waves would be "virtually impossible" without the climate pollution from major fossil fuel producers. Some individual fossil fuel companies, such as ExxonMobil, Chevron and BP, had emissions high enough to cause some of the more extreme heat waves, the research found. For the new study, the scientists looked at something called the disaster database , a global list of disasters maintained by university researchers, to identify heat waves "with significant casualties, economic losses and calls for international assistance. The scientists then used historical reconstructions and statistical models to see how human-caused global warming made each heat wave more likely and more intense. Then, to examine the link to major fossil fuel producers, the researchers relied on the Carbon Majors Database to understand the emissions of major oil, gas, coal and cement producers. "We ran a climate model to reconstruct the historical period, and then we ran it again but without the emissions of a specific carbon major, thus deducing its contribution to global warming," Yann Quilcaille, climate scientist at ETH Zurich and lead author of the study, says in an email. While some of the contributions to heat waves came from larger well-known fossil fuel companies, the study found that some smaller, lesser-known fossil fuel companies are producing enough greenhouse gas emissions to cause heat waves too, Quilcaille says. 179170762 story Gravitational Waves Finally Prove Stephen Hawking's Black Hole Theorem (newscientist.com) 34 Posted by BeauHD on Friday September 12, 2025 @03:00AM from the he-was-right-again dept. Physicists have confirmed Stephen Hawking's 1971 black hole area theorem with near-absolute certainty, thanks to gravitational waves from an exceptionally loud black hole collision detected by upgraded LIGO instruments. New Scientist reports: Hawking proposed his black hole area theorem in 1971, which states that when two black holes merge, the resulting black hole's event horizon -- the boundary beyond which not even light can escape the clutches of a black hole -- cannot have an area smaller than the sum of the two original black holes. The theorem echoes the second law of thermodynamics, which states that the entropy, or disorder within an object, never decreases. Black hole mergers warp the fabric of the universe, producing tiny fluctuations in space-time known as gravitational waves, which cross the universe at the speed of light. Five gravitational wave observatories on Earth hunt for waves 10,000 times smaller than the nucleus of an atom. They include the two US-based detectors of the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory (LIGO) plus the Virgo detector in Italy, KAGRA in Japan and GEO600 in Germany, operated by an international collaboration known as LIGO-Virgo-KAGRA (LVK). The recent collision, named GW250114, was almost identical to the one that created the first gravitational waves ever observed in 2015 . Both involved black holes with masses between 30 and 40 times the mass of our sun and took place about 1.3 billion light years away. This time, the upgraded LIGO detectors had three times the sensitivity they had in 2015, so they were able to capture waves emanating from the collision in unprecedented detail. This allowed researchers to verify Hawking's theorem by calculating that the area of the event horizon was indeed larger after the merger. The findings have been published in the journal Physical Review Letters . 179170584 story AI Use At Large Companies Is In Decline, Census Bureau Says (gizmodo.com) 60 Posted by BeauHD on Thursday September 11, 2025 @11:30PM from the behind-the-scenes dept. An anonymous reader quotes a report from Gizmodo: [D]espite the AI industry's attempts to make itself seem omnipresent, a new report this week shows that adoption at large U.S. companies has declined. The report comes from the Census Bureau and shows that the rate of AI adoption by large companies -- that is, firms with over 250 employees -- has been declining slightly in recent weeks . The report is based on a biweekly survey, dubbed Business Trends and Outlook (or BTOS), of some 1.2 million U.S. firms. The survey, which asks businesses about their use of AI tools, such as machine learning and agents, found that -- between June and now -- the rate of adoption had declined from 14 to 12 percent. Futurism notes that this is the largest drop-off in the adoption rate since the survey first began in 2023, although the survey also showed a slight increase in AI use among smaller companies. The moderate drop off comes after the rate of adoption had climbed precipitously over the last few years. When the survey first began, in September of 2023, the AI adoption rate hovered around 3.7 percent (PDF), while the adoption rate in December 2024 was around 5.7 percent. In the second quarter of this year, the rate also rose significantly, climbing from 7.4 percent to 9.2. The new drop-off in reported usage comes not long after another study, this one published by MIT, found that a vast majority of corporate AI pilot programs had failed to produce any material benefit to the companies involved. 179170642 story Windows Developers Can Now Publish Apps To Microsoft's Store Without Fees (theverge.com) 23 Posted by BeauHD on Thursday September 11, 2025 @09:30PM from the credit-card-not-required dept. Microsoft has eliminated the one-time fee for publishing apps on its Windows Store . According to The Verge, "Individual developers in nearly 200 countries can now sign up to publish apps on the Microsoft Store with just a personal Microsoft account, and no more one-time fees." From the report: Microsoft started cutting its $19 one-time fee to publish apps to its Windows store in June in certain markets, and it's now essentially removing this fee for all developers worldwide. Apple still charges an annual $99 fee to developers, and Google charges a one-time registration fee of $25. "Developers will no longer need a credit card to get started, removing a key point of friction that has affected many creators around the world," explains Chetna Das, senior product manager at Microsoft. "By eliminating these one-time fees, Microsoft is creating a more inclusive and accessible platform that empowers more developers to innovate, share and thrive on the Windows ecosystem." [...] The Microsoft Store is now used by more than 250 million monthly active users, according to Microsoft. Microsoft is now encouraging more developers to make use of the store, where they can publish a variety of Win32, UWP, PWA, .NET, MAUI, or Electron apps. Developers can even use their own in-app commerce system to keep 100 percent of their revenues on non-gaming apps. « Newer Older » Slashdot Top Deals Slashdot Top Deals Slashdot Deals Slashdot Poll When will AGI be achieved? title: يتصدر الآن
body: تخطي الروابط اذهب إلى المحتوى المميّز اذهب إلى تغذية المحتوى انتقل إلى الأكثر قراءة رابط إلى الصفحة الرئيسية للجزيرة play البث الحي تسجيل أظهر القائمة الرئيسية Navigation menu أخبار أفريقيا أبعاد رياضة مقالات بيئة اقتصاد ثقافة صحة فيديو المزيد اعرض المزيد غوث سفر سياسة تكنولوجيا مدونات الموسوعة تراث فن علوم أسلوب حياة معمّقة القدس أسرة منوعات حريات دراسات إذاعة بالصور play البث الحي اضغط هنا للبحث search تسجيل Navigation menu caret-left الآن سوريا فلسطين السودان أوكرانيا caret-right محتوى رئيسي aj-logo قد يحتوي هذا الفيديو أنماطا ضوئية أو صورا يمكن أن تسبب نوبات صرع أو عدم ارتياح لمن يعاني حساسيات بصرية الحرب على غزة.. قصف ومجازر بالقطاع ودول أوروبية تندد بهجمات إسرائيل على الدوحة blinking-dot تغطية مباشرة تغطية مباشرة, list 1 of 10 live-blue نشر منذ 6 دقائق منذ 6د أسامة حمدان: محاولة اغتيال وفد حماس بالدوحة استهداف لورقة ترامب list 2 of 10 live-blue نشر منذ 42 دقائق منذ 42د 65 شهيدا بنيران الاحتلال منذ فجر اليوم الجمعية العامة تتبنى بأغلبية ساحقة إعلانا حول حل الدولتين اعتمدت الجمعية العامة للأمم المتحدة مشروع قرار يؤيد “إعلان نيويورك” بشأن تنفيذ حل الدولتين وإقامة دولة فلسطينية وذلك بتأييد 142 دولة، ومعارضة 10 دول وامتناع 12 دولة عن التصويت. الجمعية العامة تتبنى بأغلبية ساحقة إعلانا حول حل الدولتين اعتمدت الجمعية العامة للأمم المتحدة مشروع قرار يؤيد “إعلان نيويورك” بشأن تنفيذ حل الدولتين وإقامة دولة فلسطينية وذلك بتأييد 142 دولة، ومعارضة 10 دول وامتناع 12 دولة عن التصويت. خليل الحية يؤدي صلاة الجنازة على شهداء القصف الإسرائيلي خليل الحية يؤدي صلاة الجنازة على شهداء القصف الإسرائيلي ميديا بارت الفرنسي: هكذا تعمل آلية قتل الجوعى في غزة ما انعكاسات الهجوم الإسرائيلي الفاشل على الدوحة؟ ما جديد "آبل" في "آيفون 17 برو"؟ اعتقال المشتبه به في اغتيال تشارلي كيرك الشرع: لن نسمح بتقسيم سوريا ولن نتنازل عن ذرة تراب منها 65 شهيدا بغزة منذ الفجر والتجويع يواصل حصد مزيد من الأرواح اختيارات المحررين نجلة عماد.. العراقية الملهمة التي تحدت المستحيل وصنعت المجد تشارلي كيرك.. "صانع ملوك" يميني أميركي أنهت حياته رصاصة كهف الرقيم في الأردن.. حيث يتجلى صمت المكان وعظمة الزمان مراسلون العنف السياسي الذي تخشاه أميركا بعد القبض على قاتل تشارلي كيرك 4 مسارات أمام حزب الشعب الجمهوري بعد أزمته الجارية مسيرة غاضبة في عمّان رفضا للعدوان الإسرائيلي على قطر اقتصاد هل تتحول صفقة الغاز إلى ورقة ضغط إسرائيلي ضد مصر؟ 69 مليار دولار قروضا.. أفريقيا تعود للاعتماد على صندوق النقد أميركا تدعو الدول الكبرى لمعاقبة الصين والهند بسبب النفط الروسي فيديو تدفق المحتوى مقالات الرأي نتنياهو يعلن الحرب على العالم مقال رأي بقلم بيلين فرنانديز ماذا أثبت مهاتير محمد والزعيم الكوري الانقلابي للعالم؟ مقال رأي بقلم نبيل البكيري نوحٌ يعبر البحر المتوسط بسفنه مقال رأي بقلم كمال أوزتورك القصف في الدوحة إثبات للفشل الإسرائيلي مقال رأي بقلم محمُود الرنتيسي بعد "واقعة الدوحة".. هل من موقف عربي مغاير هذه المرة؟ مقال رأي بقلم عريب الرنتاوي الكابوس الأكبر لإسرائيل الآن مقال رأي بقلم د. عبد الله معروف القدس اقتحام واسع لمخيم شعفاط بالقدس والاحتلال يواصل حملته بطولكرم اقتحمت قوات كبيرة من جيش الاحتلال الإسرائيلي مخيم شعفاط شمال القدس، حيث أطلقت النار وقنابل الغاز، مما أدى لإصابة شابين أحدهما بحالة خطرة، فيما واصلت حملتها العسكرية على محافظة طولكرم المستمرة منذ أمس. الأجهزة الأمنية الإسرائيلية تحذر من عملية غزة ونتنياهو يصر على تنفيذها ذكرت هيئة البث الإسرائيلية أن قادة الأجهزة الأمنية حذروا، خلال اجتماع مع رئيس الوزراء بنيامين نتنياهو المطلوب للمحكمة الجنائية الدولية، من احتلال مدينة غزة. ترجمات هآرتس: الهجوم الفاشل على الدوحة يبدد وهم قدرة إسرائيل على فعل ما تريد كشف كاتب إسرائيلي عن أن نجاة قادة حركة حماس في الهجوم عليهم وسط الدوحة، وسعي قطر لاتخاذ إجراءات فورية ضد إسرائيل، يؤكد أن رئيس الوزراء بنيامين نتنياهو فشل فشلا ذريعا في استعادة قوة إسرائيل. Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 واشنطن بوست: حرب الهند الخفية ضد إحدى أقدم حركات التمرد في العالم شهدت الهند على مدى عقود واحدة من أطول حركات التمرد المسلح في العالم، التي اشتعلت شرارتها عام 1967 في قرية ناكسالباري بولاية البنغال الغربية شرقي البلاد، عقب مقتل مزارع أجير على يد ملاك الأراضي. Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 صحف عالمية: إدانة هجوم قطر أمميا يظهر حالة توحد نادرة ضد إسرائيل ركزت صحف عالمية الضوء على إدانة مجلس الأمن الدولي القصف الإسرائيلي على العاصمة القطرية الدوحة، وآخر التطورات الميدانية على صعيد الحرب الإسرائيلية على قطاع غزة. Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 تايمز: "جيل زد" يختار زعيم نيبال المؤقت عبر الذكاء الاصطناعي بعد ثورة عارمة نجحت في إسقاط الحكومة النيبالية خلال 48 ساعة، اختار “جيل زد” اللجوء إلى “شات جي بي تي” للتعامل مع تحدي اختيار قيادة البلاد المستقبلية، حسب صحيفة تايمز البريطانية. Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 تشارلي كيرك: صوت المحافظين الشباب الذي أثار الجدل ورحل مقتولا قالت صحيفة نيويورك تايمز إن مقتل الناشط اليميني تشارلي كيرك ترك فراغا كبيرا في أوساط الشباب المحافظين، الذين رأوا فيه صوتا معبرا عنهم. Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 المزيد فرنسا وألمانيا وبريطانيا تدين الهجوم الإسرائيلي على قطر أعرب وزراء خارجية بريطانيا وفرنسا وألمانيا في بيان مشترك، عن إدانتهم للهجوم الإسرائيلي على الدوحة، مؤكدين تضامنهم مع دولة قطر والدور الذي تقوم به في الوساطة من أجل إنهاء الحرب على غزة. رياضة تشلسي في ورطة بعد إصابة ديلاب وغيابه لفترة طويلة يغيب مهاجم تشلسي ليام ديلاب عن الملاعب حتى ديسمبر/كانون الأول بعد تعرضه لإصابة في العضلة الخلفية للركبة. Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 لامين جمال عن العنصرية: هل رأيت شخصا أسود يقول لآخر أنت أبيض؟ تحول الموهبة لامين جمال في ظرف قياسي إلى نجم كبير ليس في صفوف برشلونة فقط بل عالميا رغم حداثة سنه. ومعه شهد نظام ونمط حياته تغيرا كبيرا أيضا سواء في علاقاته أو في تعامله مع محيطه الجديد. Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 توتر بين فيرمين وغافي يثير القلق في برشلونة خيم التوتر على غرفة ملابس برشلونة خلال الأسابيع الأخيرة بسبب العلاقة المتوترة بين ثنائي خط الوسط فيرمين لوبيز وزميله غافي التي قد تؤثر على أداء الفريق. Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 المهاجمون الأكثر تسجيلا للأهداف قبل سن 21 عاما في عالم كرة القدم، قليلون استطاعوا فرض أنفسهم في سن مبكرة، لكن هناك أسماء استثنائية تركت بصمة قوية قبل أن تبلغ حتى عامها الـ21، لا سيما في مركز الهجوم. Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 نشأت أكرم أيقونة عراقية أجهض قانون إنجليزي حلم انضمامه لمانشستر سيتي في تاريخ كرة القدم العراقية، يبرز اسم نشأت أكرم كأحد أبرز النجوم الذين حملوا أحلام الجماهير داخل وخارج البلاد. Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 المزيد الصين تنفي علمها بمسيّرات تستخدمها قوات الدعم السريع بالسودان نفت وزارة الخارجية الصينية اليوم الجمعة أي علم لها بمسيرات تحدثت تقارير إعلامية أن قوات الدعم السريع تستخدمها في حربها مع الجيش السوداني. مدونات مختارة قطر وفلسطين: أخوّة الدم والدعم جاء الاستهداف الغاشم ليزيد ويعمق مصداقية قطر لدى الشعوب الإسلامية والعربية، ولدى أحرار العالم، فلقطر تاريخ طويل في مواجهة العدوان الغاشم؛ لأنها انحازت باكرا، بل قل لأنها تأسست على عون الضعيف وحمايته. مدونة بقلم المختار القاسم المختار القاسم Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 quotes غزة وعمر بن سيد: حكاية عبودية وحرب هذه واحدة من الليالي الكبيسة؛ حيث لا نوم، ولا أمان، والمدينة تغرق في صمت قاتل مخيف، يقطعه صوت الصواريخ وارتطامها بالمباني، وأصوات أبواق إسعاف متقطعة تولول لنجدة أحدهم.. مدونة بقلم غادة زهير غادة زهير Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 quotes عندما حارب سارتر في صف المقاومة حين يُذكر جان بول سارتر يُستدعى إلى الذهن فورا الفيلسوف والكاتب الفرنسي الذي صاغ معالم الوجودية الحديثة، وعُرف بجرأته الأخلاقية والفكرية، ونزعته الوجودية التحررية التي جعلت من الحرية عبئا وجوديا. مدونة بقلم أسماء بن علي أسماء بن علي Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 quotes تاريخ الخط العربي: المسار الزمكاني للتطور (1) تطور الحرف من الصورة الكاملة إلى الصورة الرمزية ثم إلى مقطع صوتي منفصل، وهي الحروف، ثم تضامّت الحروف المفككة لتشكّل كلمة، ومن الكلمات اتحد جملًا. مدونة بقلم واصف أبو عجمية واصف أبو عجمية Published On 12/9/2025 12/9/2025 quotes الأكاديميون وطوفان الأقصى: وقع الحسام وعجز اللسان إن الغاية الأساسية من البحث العلمي هي التأثير الذي ينعكس على رفاهية الإنسان، والارتقاء بالمجتمع من خلال حل معضلاته واستشراف مستقبله.. مدونة بقلم هاني إسماعيل رمضان هاني إسماعيل رمضان Published On 7/9/2025 7/9/2025 quotes المزيد aj-logo aj-logo aj-logo يتصدر الآن "علقوها على الشجرة".. قصة الفتاة قسمة تفجر غضبا شعبيا بالسودان quotes نتنياهو يعلن الحرب على العالم الجمعية العامة تتبنى بأغلبية ساحقة إعلانا حول حل الدولتين الحرب على غزة مباشر.. قصف ومجازر بالقطاع ودول أوروبية تندد بهجمات إسرائيل على الدوحة اعتقال المشتبه به في اغتيال تشارلي كيرك quotes الكابوس الأكبر لإسرائيل الآن خليل الحية يؤدي صلاة الجنازة على شهداء القصف الإسرائيلي العنف السياسي الذي تخشاه أميركا بعد القبض على قاتل تشارلي كيرك الشرع: لن نسمح بتقسيم سوريا ولن نتنازل عن ذرة تراب منها بين الإيمان والتاريخ.. اكتشف أسرار كهف أهل الكهف بالأردن aj-logo إعلان من نحن من نحن اعرض المزيد من نحن الأحكام والشروط سياسة الخصوصية سياسة ملفات تعريف
